intro: Rhododendron oblongum, commonly known as the Chinese rhododendron, is a species native to China and Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters. The plant features broad, elliptical leaves that are dark green and glossy on top, with a lighter underside. Its flowers are borne in dense clusters and are usually pink to purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Rhododendron oblongum thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
